note.label: This section lists all the available attributes for the Google Shopping Feed. Some attributes are required for all products and some are required for certain product types such as apparel, others are recommended. To avoid errors in the Google Shopping feed please make sure that you provide all recommended attributes.

name.label: Name Attribute
name.tooltip: You can use the -custom attribute option from the dropdown to create a custom name using active attributes.

name_custom.label: Custom Name
name_custom.tooltip: You can create a custom name using active attributes like {{atributecode}} {{atributecode}}.

condition_note.label: The condition is an required field for the feed. Only three options are available: New, Refurbished & Used. Please select the default condition of your products, when you change the condition on product-level in the Google Shopping Tab the product-condition will be overwritten.

gtin_note.label: Use the GTIN/Barcode attribute to submit Global Trade Item Numbers (GTINs) in one of the following formats: UPC (in North America), EAN (in Europe), JAN (in Japan) or ISBN (for books). Please select the attribute that provide these GTINs (for eg. SKU).

brand_note.label: Required according to the Unique Product Identifier Rules for all target countries except for Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, India, Mexico, Norway, Poland, Russia, Sweden, and Turkey. This attribute is recommended for Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, India, Mexico, Norway, Poland, Russia, Sweden, and Turkey. Note: Don't provide your store name as the brand unless you manufacture the product.

mpn_note.label: The Manufacturer Part Number is used to reference and identify a product using a manufacturer specific naming other than GTIN. MPNs are assigned by a manufacturer. MPNs should typically be specific to a single unique product. For example, different colors of a product should have different MPNs.

category_note.label: Products are categorized in Google Shopping according to the Google product taxonomy. While Google can't guarantee that a product will show in a particular category, you can increase the chances that your products will be included in the most relevant categories by sending them highly structured information for your items. Click here to read more about the Google product Taxonomy inlcuding the different categories. For more information how to set this up per category see our Knowledge Base

extra_note.label: You are recommended to provide the following product information for each unique item you submit if it exists, is relevant, and if the information fits into the accepted values for the following detailed product attributes:

tax_note.label:
By default prices are shown incl. Tax so only change this option if necessary.
If the feed export is without tax it's possible to add it with this option.

tax_percentage.label: Percentage
tax_percentage.comment: When the tax percentage is 21% use 21.

identifier_note.label: This new attribute was created for shops that offer custom goods without an identifier like GTIN or MPN. Custom goods are hand knitted sweaters or antique furniture or vintage items. The ‘Identifier Exists’ field can be used to indicate that an identifier does not exist for certain products: Identifier exists = false. It is best to always try and use at least two of identifiers as this is a huge plus for your listing.Read more

producttype_note.label: The ‘product type’ attribute can also indicates the category of the product being sold. Other then the Google Category Taxonomy gives the Product Types attribute more control over how your products are segmented as it uses your Magento Category structure.

extra_note.label: You can add custom-fields to your feed when needed. Please make sure that your using the latest Custom Fields standards To prevent error messages in the feed. The guidelines for the custom-fields can be found right in our Knowledgebase.

shipping_note.label:
Add the Shipping rates directly in the feed to meet the Google Merchant Requirements.
You can set the price range of the products with a From and To price with the right shipping price for that specific product price range as last column.

weight_note.label: This is the weight of the product used to calculate the shipping cost of the item. If you have specified a global shipping method that is dependent on shipping weight (Merchant Dashboard), this attribute will be used to calculate the shipping cost of the item automatically.

configurable_note.label: When using configurable or grouped products the simple products will be shown in the feed. You can choose to pull information from the parent products. Select in the multiple-select box below the fall-back data for the configurable / grouped products in the feed.

simple_price.label: Use Simple Product Pricing
simple_price.comment: Only enable this option when you have enabled an extension that is using the simple prices in your store.

conf_switch_urls.label: Configurable Switch Urls
conf_switch_urls.comment: Create a specific url for the simple products inside the configurable products to make sure the prices and information is correct for Google.

note_url.label: When your using Google Analytics you can add your UTM tags right here, eg. utm_source=googleshopping&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=googleshopping

note.label: This option allows you to include/exclude product from the Google Shopping Feed. To exclude certain products from the Google Shopping feed you easily select yes in the Google Shopping tab on your product configuration page.

visibility_heading.label: Only add products with the following visibility

note.label: Each store view will have their own Google Shopping feed, you can easily activate or de-activate the Google Shopping feed generation on store level or automatically generate the Google Shopping feed. In case your not using the cron job functionality it's possible to generate the Google Shopping feed manually.

limit.label: Limit
limit.comment: Set limit for testing, use 0 for all products

overwrite.label: Enabled
overwrite.tooltip: Only use this option if it's necessary to overwrite this setting because of your server memory limit or execution time.xecution time.

memory_limit.label: Memory Limit
memory_limit.comment: This overwrites the maximum amount of memory in bytes that a script is allowed to allocate, eg: 1024M.

max_execution_time.label: Max Execution Time
max_execution_time.comment: This overwrites the maximum time in seconds a script is allowed to run before it is terminated by the parser, eg: 300 (for 5 minutes).

time.label: Start Time
time.tooltip: When using multiple feeds, the cron will run several times during this hour. For example when set to 12:00 with 3 feeds it will run at 12:00, 12:20, 12:40

feeds_note.label:
All active feeds are shown in the overview below.
The .XML URL is the URL which can be provided to your Google Merchant account. Regarding some cache settings in the browser it's also possible to download the Feed to make sure that you are viewing the latest version. Regarding the Caching and settings there is a small note in the beginning of the XML file where you can find the time of generation and the number of products.

Note: Make sure that you save the configuration after settings are changed and before you generate the feed.
